page.title: 15HOME LIFE 2
page.content: { HOUSEWIFE IN CARRINGTON I normally get up every morning at 7 o'clock to make my husbands breakfast. He leaves for his work at an insurance office in Edinburgh at 8 o'clock. We own a car which is really essential. The bus service in Carrington is not very good and we are probably cheaper running a car than paying the bus fares. I have a baby daughter who takes up most of my time and she adds some fun to my day. After doing my housework I sometimes take the bus to Dalkeith or Bonnyrigg which is the nearest shopping centre, but it is very small. At the weekend we go by car into Edinburgh to one of the large supermarkets to do our monthly shopping. Our milk is delivered only three times a week.
